reviews.review:
I was hesitant to pick up this game when it was on sale for $10, as I wasnt sure it'd be my kinda game.

That was a couple days ago, and Ive been playing it almost non stop. Dead by daylight is a unique multiplayer game, that constantly has me on the edge of my seat. It stays interesting because of all the different survivors, killers and perks to unlock to make you a stronger killer or a teammate that anyone would be thrilled to have.

My only gripe is some of the community is a bit toxic... but what are ya gonna do. That comes with any popular multiplayer game.

es bastante entretenido y sobretodo divertido

You spend most of your time on non-playing screens.  Just learning the mechanics is a trial of its own, then figuring out how to play well enough to compete with other people online is crazy-making.  The creators did a great job with making the atmosphere horror-like, but the constant gloominess is a serious trigger for people who already have depression issues.  Staying immersed in it when you have such issues is extremely unhealthy.

Beyond that, it's updating ALL THE TIME.  I've literally spent more time with this game updating than I have actually playing it-- and after the most recent update, in which I spent over an hour waiting for it to download a relatively small file (no, the issue is not my computer; immediately before this one's update I downloaded a Cyberpunk 2077 update that was more than 10 times the size, and it completed in less than a sixth of the time it took for the DBD update) now the game won't even run!  It just crashes before even loading!  

So thanks, Million & tenth frickin' "update", I actually got the urge to play again and now CAN'T.

Oh yeah, and I didn't even mention this great element: Nearly every character is a pay-to-play download.  That's right, you pay a AAA game price on the initial game, then you pay another $7 to $12 for every single new Villain beyond like the fifth or sixth, I forget how many in the original game but it wasn't a lot.

Save your time, your money, your life-force, and skip this one.  Friday the 13th was the original format for this game style anyway, and arguably is the superior game.

I actually like this game, but experiencing more bugs lately, unbalanced matchmaking and occasionally getting kicked out of the match (and penalized for it) even if my internet was relatively ok at those times. I do love and appreciate their new releases. Just wish the devs also focus on fixing the existing bugs.

Edit: 11/26 - Love the new updates so far and servers are now more stable compared before.

Sincerely,
